author: ryg9705
content: <@!542790137088835595> The information about the address of different services like discovery and rpc is printed at the very beginning when you start your node. Which command line options did you pass to geth when you started it?

author: diegolosada
content: Hi, guys. We've manage to run and sync Geth+Lighthouse (and send a transaction with Metamask) but we are getting some trouble with Prysm and Nimbus (Nimbus syncs but it falls behind the chain and Prysm doesn't sync). Should we open an issue directly on the teams Github or is there other location to report to the kintsugi issues?

author: diegolosada
content: All tests were ran on a Raspberry Pi 4 with 8 GB RAM

author: diegolosada
content: And all clients compiled as instructed

author: parithosh
content: I think it would be best to create issues at the respective client team repo's for visibility. I think the prysm team is aware they have a sync issue, but i haven't faced an issue with nimbus - so it would be interesting to see what it is üôÇ

author: diegolosada
content: Great, I will try to do some more tests and collect the data this weekend.

author: remyroy
content:
Trying to build `fix-optimistic-sync` branch from http://github.com/mariusvanderwijden/go-ethereum and I'm getting the following error. Anyone knows how to fix this?
> $ make geth
> env GO111MODULE=on go run build/ci.go install ./cmd/geth
> >>> /usr/lib/go-1.13/bin/go build -ldflags -X main.gitCommit=6273aecfb546ec0637ed77917ca9bff39ce658d8 -X main.gitDate=20211130 -extldflags -Wl,-z,stack-size=0x800000 -trimpath -v -o /home/remy/go-ethereum/build/bin/geth ./cmd/geth
> build github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/cmd/geth: cannot load hash/maphash: malformed module path "hash/maphash": missing dot in first path element
> util.go:46: exit status 1
> exit status 1
> make: *** [Makefile:12: geth] Error 1
